snippet: Researchers conducting a trial have found that a bone marrow transplant from a donor who is only half-matched genetically can cure sickle cell.
abstract: Dr Robert A Brodsky study in journal Blood finds that bone marrow transplants from a donor who is only half-matched genetically to a recipient can cure sickle cell disease, discovery that greatly increases chances of finding donors for those suffering from the condition.
lead_paragraph: Researchers conducting a trial have found that a bone marrow transplant from a donor who is only half-matched genetically can cure sickle cell.

headline.main: Sickle Cell Transplants Could See Wider Use
